sen.j: 宿曜道（すくようどう）とは、平安時代、空海をはじめとする留学僧らにより、密教の一分野として 日本へもたらされた占星術の一種。
sen.e: The term "Sukuyodo" refers to a kind of astrology which was brought to Japan as a part of the Esoteric Buddhism by priests who studied abroad such as Kukai in the Heian period.
The term "Sukuyodo" refers to a kind of astrology which was brought to Japan as a part of the Esoteric Buddhism by priests who studied abroad such as Kukai in the Heian period.
The term "Sukuyodo" refers to a kind of astrology which was brought to Japan as a part of the Esoteric Buddhism by priests who studied abroad such as Kukai in the Heian period.

sen.j: 密教占星術、宿曜占星術などともいう。
sen.e: It is also called the Esoteric Buddhism astrology or Sukuyo astrology.
It is also called the Esoteric Buddhism astrology or Sukuyo astrology.
It is also called the Esoteric Buddhism astrology or Sukuyo astrology.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: その内容は、インド占星術（ギリシャ由来の西洋占星術とインド古来の月占星術が習合したもの）、道教由来の天体神信仰、陰陽五行説等が習合した雑多なものである。
sen.e: It is a syncretization of the Indian astrology (syncretization of Western astrology originated from Greece and moon astrology originated from India), the faith of heavenly body's god originated from Taoism, The Theory of Five Elements in Yin-Yang and so on.

It is a synchronization of the Indian astrology (syncretization of Western astrology originated from Greece and moon astrology originated from India), the faith of heavenly body's god originated from Taoism, The Theory of Five Elements in Yin-Yang and so on.

It is a synchronization of the Indian astrology (syncretization of Western astrology originated from Greece and moon astrology originated from India), the faith of heavenly body's god originated from Taoism, The Theory of Five Elements in Yin-Yang and so on.

sen.j: 基本的に、北斗七星・九曜・十二宮・二十七宿または二十八宿などの天体の動きや七曜の曜日の巡りによってその直日を定め、それが凶であった場合は、その星の神々を祀る事によって運勢を好転させようとする。
sen.e: Basically, it defines chinichi (a specific day of a heavenly body, 直日) by the movements of celestial bodies and rotation of seven luminaries such as North Dipper Seven Stars, Kuyo (nine-planet crest), the twelve signs of the zodiac, nijunanashuku (Twenty-seven mansions of the Chinese constellation) or nijuhachishuku (Twenty-eight mansions of it), and if it is Kyo (Bad Fortune) it tries to improve its fortune by enshrining gods of that star.
sen.cmt: 直日の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: Basically, it defines chinichi (a specific day of a heavenly body, 直日) by the movements of celestial bodies and rotation of seven luminaries such as North Dipper Seven Stars, Kuyo (nine-planet crest), the twelve signs of the zodiac, nijunanashuku (Twenty-seven mansions of the Chinese constellation) or nijuhachishuku (Twenty-eight mansions of it), and if it is Kyo (Bad Fortune) it tries to improve its fortune by enshrining gods of that star.

Basically, a chinichi (a specific day on which a heavenly body exerts an influence on the Earth) is determined based on the movements of the celestial bodies—such as the Big Dipper, Kuyo (the nine primary celestial beings), the twelve signs of the zodiac, nijunanashuku (twenty-seven mansions of the Chinese constellation) or nijuhachishuku (twenty-eight mansions of the Chinese constellation)—and the rotation of what were known as the "seven luminaries", and if Kyo (bad fortune) was predicted, the gods of the star in question were enshrined to bring good fortune.
sen.cmt: 宿曜道が直日を定めるというよりは、直日が定められると受動態にしました。後半も受動態にしました。後半修正しました。

sen.j: 所依の教典は、『宿曜経』・『梵天火羅九曜』・『七曜星辰別行法』などである。
sen.e: It is based on the scriptures of "Sukuyokyo sutra" (宿曜経), "Bontenkarakuyo" (梵天火羅九曜), "Shichiyoshoshinbetsugyoho" (七曜星辰別行法) and so on.
sen.cmt: 宿曜経、梵天火羅九曜、七曜星辰別行法の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: It is based on the scriptures of "Sukuyokyo sutra" (宿曜経), "Bontenkarakuyo" (梵天火羅九曜), "Shichiyoshoshinbetsugyoho" (七曜星辰別行法) and so on.
It is based on the scriptures of "Sukuyokyo sutra" (宿曜経), "Bontenkarakuyo" (梵天火羅九曜), "Shichiyoshoshinbetsugyoho" (七曜星辰別行法) and so on.

sen.j: 三九秘宿という独特の技法がある。
sen.e: It has a unique technique named Sankunohishuku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has a unique technique named Sankunohishuku.
It has a unique technique named Sankunohishuku.

sen.j: これを簡略化したものが、一般に「宿曜占星術」として流布している。
sen.e: What simplified this is generally used as 'Sukuyo astrology.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A simplified version of this technique is generally used as 'Sukuyo astrology.'
A simplified version of this technique is generally used as 'Sukuyo astrology.'

sen.j: 密教では、造像・修法・灌頂などを行う際には吉日良辰を選ぶこととされていた。
sen.e: In the Esoteric Buddhism, it was determined that a lucky day should be chosen for the events such as making a statue, Shuho (an esoteric ritual) and kanjo (a ceremony to be the successor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Esoteric Buddhism, it was determined that a lucky day should be chosen for the events such as making a statue, Shuho (an esoteric ritual) and kanjo (a ceremony to be the successor).
In the Esoteric Buddhism, it was determined that a lucky day should be chosen for the events such as making a statue, Shuho (an esoteric ritual) and kanjo (a ceremony to be the successor).

sen.j: 一行の『大日経疏』では、吉日良辰の選定は阿闍梨の資質が問われる大切な作業とされていた。
sen.e: In "Dainichikyo-sho"written by Ichigyo, choosing a lucky day was regarded as an important task which showed the ability of Ajari (a master in esoteric Buddhism; a high priest).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In "Dainichikyo-sho" written by Ichigyo, choosing a lucky day was regarded as an important task which showed the ability of Ajari (a master in esoteric Buddhism; a high priest).
In "Dainichikyo-sho" written by Ichigyo, choosing a lucky day was regarded as an important task which showed the ability of Ajari (a master in esoteric Buddhism; a high priest).

sen.j: そのために、空海・円仁・円珍らが『宿曜経』を日本に請来し、仁観が深く研究した。
sen.e: For this reason, Kukai, Ennin, Enchin and others asked to bring "Sukuyokyo sutra" to Japan, and Ninkan studied it deeply.
For this reason, Kukai, Ennin, Enchin and others asked to bring "Sukuyokyo sutra" to Japan, and Ninkan studied it deeply.
For this reason, Kukai, Ennin, Enchin and others asked to bring "Sukuyokyo sutra" to Japan, and Ninkan studied it deeply.

sen.j: 957年（天徳 (日本)元年）、日延が呉越より符天暦を持ち帰ったことによりその研究が盛んになった。
sen.e: Nichien brought Futenreki (the Futian calendar table) from Wu-yueh in 957, which made its study active.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nichien brought Futenreki (the Futian calendar table) from Wu-yueh in 957, which made its study active.
Nichien brought Futenreki (the Futian calendar table) from Wu-yueh in 957, which made its study active.

sen.j: 法蔵 (日本)が応和元年（963年）に時の村上天皇の御本命供の期日を巡って陰陽道の賀茂保憲と論争を行っている。
sen.e: In 963 Hozo (Japan) made a dispute with KAMO no Yasunori of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) over the date of 御本命供 of the Emperor Murakami in those days.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。御本命供の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: In 963 Hozo (Japan) made a dispute with KAMO no Yasunori of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) over the date of 御本命供 of the Emperor Murakami in those days.

In 963 Hozo (Japan) made a dispute with KAMO no Yasunori of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) over the date of 御本命供 of the Emperor Murakami in those days.

sen.j: したがって、この時期に日本の宿曜道が確立したと見られている。
sen.e: Therefore, it seems that Sukuyodo in Japan was established around this time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it seems that Sukuyodo in Japan was established around this time.
Therefore, it seems that Sukuyodo in Japan was established around this time.

sen.j: なお、『二中歴』では法蔵をもって日本の宿曜道の祖としている。
sen.e: In addition, "Nichureki" (Dual History) regards Hozo as a founder of Sukuyodo in Japan.
In addition, "Nichureki" (Dual History) regards Hozo as a founder of Sukuyodo in Japan.
In addition, "Nichureki" (Dual History) regards Hozo as a founder of Sukuyodo in Japan.

sen.j: こうした経緯から宿曜師は密教僧である例が多かった。
sen.e: By such a development, most of the sukuyoshi (master of an astrology based on the Sutra of constellations and planets) were priests of the Esoteric Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: By such a development, most of the sukuyoshi (master of astrology based on the Sutra of constellations and planets) were priests of the Esoteric Buddhism.
By such a development, most of the sukuyoshi (master of astrology based on the Sutra of constellations and planets) were priests of the Esoteric Buddhism.

sen.j: 誕生月日などを元にして星占いを行ってその結果を記した「宿曜勘文」を作成した。
sen.e: They casted a horoscope based on a birthday and made 'Sukuyo kanmon' (a report of Sukuyo) in which the result was written.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They cast a horoscope based on a birthday and made 'Sukuyo kanmon' (a report of Sukuyo) in which the result was written.
They cast a horoscope based on a birthday and made 'Sukuyo kanmon' (a report of Sukuyo) in which the result was written.

sen.j: また、長徳元年（995年）には、興福寺の仁宗 (僧)に対して暦道と共同で暦を作成するようにという「造暦宣旨」が下されている（興福寺は法相宗であるが、この時代には真言宗との関係も強かったとされる）。
sen.e: In 995, 'an imperial decree to make a calendar' with Rekido (scholars of calendar) was given to Ninso (a priest) of the Kofuku-ji Temple (although the Kofuku-ji Temple was a temple of the Hosso sect, it was regarded to have a strong relationship with the Shingon sect).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 995, 'an imperial decree to make a calendar' with Rekido (scholars of calendar) was given to Ninso (a priest) of the Kofuku-ji Temple (although the Kofuku-ji Temple was a temple of the Hosso sect, it was regarded to have a strong relationship with the Shingon sect).

In 995, 'an imperial decree to make a calendar' with Rekido (scholars of calendar) was given to Ninso (a priest) of the Kofuku-ji Temple (although the Kofuku-ji Temple was a temple of the Hosso sect, it was regarded to have a strong relationship with the Shingon sect).

sen.j: ただし、長暦2年（1038年）に暦道と宿曜道との全面対立により宿曜道側が造暦から撤退している。
sen.e: However, Rekido and Sukuyodo made a conflict in 1038 and Sukuyodo gave up making a calendar.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Rekido and Sukuyodo made a conflict in 1038 and Sukuyodo gave up making a calendar.
However, Rekido and Sukuyodo made a conflict in 1038 and Sukuyodo gave up making a calendar.

sen.j: 以後も日食・月食の発生日時や大小月や閏月を巡って暦道と激しく争った。
sen.e: It continued to fight with Rekido over the date and time of solar eclipse and lunar eclipse, daisho tsuki (months which had 31 days or 30 days), or a leap month.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It continued to fight with Rekido over the date and time of solar and lunar eclipses, daisho tsuki (months which had 31 days or 30 days), or leap months.
It continued to fight with Rekido over the date and time of solar and lunar eclipses, daisho tsuki (months which had 31 days or 30 days), or leap months.

sen.j: また、宿曜勘文などや星供・祭供などの祈祷の奉仕を通じて権力者と結びついて、法隆寺や西大寺 (奈良市)などの別当に任命される者もいた。
sen.e: In addition, tied with an influential person through the works of Sukuyo kanmon or prayers such as Hoshiku (Buddhist service for celebrating the star of a person's born year) and Saigu (festivals with altarage), some Sukuyoshi were assigned to betto (the superior of a temple) of the Horyu-ji Temple, the Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City) and so on.

In addition, tied with an influential person through the works of Sukuyo kanmon or prayers such as Hoshiku (Buddhist service for celebrating the star of a person's born year) and Saigu (festivals with altarage), some Sukuyoshi were assigned to betto (the superior of a temple) of the Horyu-ji Temple, the Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City) and so on.

In addition, tied with an influential person through the works of Sukuyo kanmon or prayers such as Hoshiku (Buddhist service for celebrating the star of a person's born year) and Saigu (festivals with altarage), some Sukuyoshi were assigned to betto (the superior of a temple) of the Horyu-ji Temple, the Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City) and so on.

sen.j: 平安時代後期には能算・明算 (宿曜師)父子が活躍して白河天皇や摂関家に仕えた。
sen.e: In the latter part of the Heian period, Nosan and his son Myosan (明算) flourished and served the Emperor Shirakawa and Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。明算の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: In the latter part of the Heian period, Nosan and his son Myosan (明算) flourished and served the Emperor Shirakawa and Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents).
In the latter part of the Heian period, Nosan and his son Myosan (明算) flourished and served the Emperor Shirakawa and Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents).

sen.j: 続く平安時代末期には天台宗の流れを汲む珍賀と興福寺及び真言宗の流れを汲む慶算という2名の優れた宿曜師が出現した。
sen.e: In the end of the Heian period, there appeared two excellent Sukuyoshi named Chinga (珍賀) who was a lineage of the Tendai sect and Keisan (慶算) who was a lineage of the Kofuku-ji Temple and the Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。珍賀、慶算の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: In the end of the Heian period, there appeared two excellent Sukuyoshi named Chinga (珍賀) who belonged to the Tendai sect and Keisan (慶算) who belonged to the Kofuku-ji Temple and the Shingon sect.
In the end of the Heian period, there appeared two excellent Sukuyoshi named Chinga (珍賀) who belonged to the Tendai sect and Keisan (慶算) who belonged to the Kofuku-ji Temple and the Shingon sect.

sen.j: 互いに技術を磨きながら権力者と連携して勢力を争い、一族・門人によって流派が形成される程であった。
sen.e: Improving their skills each other, they struggled to gain a power so much by cooperating with an influential person as their family and disciplines formed a school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Improving their skills each other, they struggled to gain a power so much by cooperating with an influential person as their family and disciplines formed a school.

In collaboration with a person in authority, they fought each other to gain influence, and in doing so they improved their skills in so many ways that their family members and/or disciples formed new schools.
sen.cmt: お互いに技術を磨いているうちにいろんなスタイルができた、という訳に修正しました。

sen.j: だが、南北朝時代 (日本)以後の貴族社会の衰退とともに宿曜道も没落の道を辿った。
sen.e: However, Sukuyodo went to ruin in accordance with a decline of the noble society after the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Sukuyodo went to ruin in accordance with a decline of the noble society after the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
However, Sukuyodo went to ruin in accordance with a decline of the noble society after the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 長寛3年（1165年）に珍賀が創建して宿曜道の拠点となった北斗降臨院が応永24年（1417年）に焼失すると、以後歴史から姿を消すこととなる。
sen.e: After Hokutorinkoin (北斗降臨院), which was established by Chinga in 1165 and had been a base of Sukuyodo, was burnt down in 1417, it disappeared from the history.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。北斗降臨院の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: After Hokutorinkoin (北斗降臨院), which was established as a base of Sukuyodo by Chinga in 1165 and burnt down in 1417, it disappeared from the history.
After Hokutorinkoin (北斗降臨院), which was established as a base of Sukuyodo by Chinga in 1165 and burnt down in 1417, it disappeared from the history.

sen.j: 『源氏物語』桐壺にも、主人公・光源氏が誕生した際、宿曜師にその運命を占わせる場面が出てくる。
sen.e: In the volume of Kiritsubo in "The Tale of Genji" there is a scene that when the main character Hikaru Genji was born, Sukuyoshi told his fortune.
In the volume of Kiritsubo in "The Tale of Genji" there is a scene that when the main character Hikaru Genji was born, Sukuyoshi told his fortune.
In the volume of Kiritsubo in "The Tale of Genji" there is a scene that when the main character Hikaru Genji was born, Sukuyoshi told his fortune.
